content.raw:
I didn't get into it very much, but it looks like the way Linux and OSX handle unresolved symbols differ. Quote from one of the following SO posts:
>  `undefined dynamic_lookup` which will mark all undefined symbols as having to be looked up at runtime.

But apparently, it's not [recommended](https://stackoverflow.com/a/30934307).

* https://stackoverflow.com/questions/25421479/clang-and-undefined-symbols-when-building-a-library
* https://stackoverflow.com/questions/2339679/what-are-the-differences-between-so-and-dylib-on-osx
content.html:
I didn't get into it very much, but it looks like the way Linux and OSX handle unresolved symbols differ. Quote from one of the following SO posts:

undefined dynamic_lookup which will mark all undefined symbols as having to be looked up at runtime.

But apparently, it's not recommended.

  • https://stackoverflow.com/questions/25421479/clang-and-undefined-symbols-when-building-a-library
  • https://stackoverflow.com/questions/2339679/what-are-the-differences-between-so-and-dylib-on-osx
